The great majority of scientists work on things that have nothing to do with entertainment value or politics.  There are some controversial areas - such as stem cell research, cloning, etc. - that do overlap with politics or even entertainment, but the great majority of scientists work on things that are neither entertaining to people in general nor politically charged. As for those who do work on things such things as stem cell research, my understanding is that they are willing to work within such a politically charged issue because they feel that the results of their research can save many lives. From my understanding, though some money has been invested in stem cell research and cloning, neither of these have yielded anyone any profit yet. 
 
 If scientists did not ever make investigations into controversial issues, then we would all still be going around thinking that the sun revolves around a flat earth. I agree that scientists should not purposely pursue an immoral path, but very often there is simply a genuine disagreement about the morals of a particular path.

As a private person, I would still like to hold onto some religious beliefs, but these have to fit within the unexplained areas of Science (of which there are still enough to leave some room for religion). I simply cannot see how people can openly put on blinders to ignore scientific findings.
